component.name: jclouds
component.title: JClouds
component.description: Interact with jclouds compute and blobstore service.
component.label: api,cloud,compute

blobStores.description: To use the given BlobStore which must be configured when using blobstore.

computeServices.description: To use the given ComputeService which must be configured when use compute.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

CamelJcloudsContainerName.label: producer blobstore
CamelJcloudsContainerName.description: The name of the blob container.

CamelJcloudsOperation.label: producer
CamelJcloudsOperation.description: The operation to be performed on the blob. The valid options are: PUT GET

CamelJcloudsImageId.label: producer compute
CamelJcloudsImageId.description: The imageId that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

CamelJcloudsLocationId.label: producer
CamelJcloudsLocationId.description: The location that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

CamelJcloudsHardwareId.label: producer compute
CamelJcloudsHardwareId.description: The hardware that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

CamelJcloudsGroup.label: producer compute
CamelJcloudsGroup.description: The group that will be assigned to the newly created node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

CamelJcloudsNodeId.label: producer compute
CamelJcloudsNodeId.description: The id of the node that will run the script or destroyed.

CamelJcloudsUser.label: producer compute
CamelJcloudsUser.description: The user on the target node that will run the script.

command.description: What command to execute such as blobstore or compute.

providerId.description: The name of the cloud provider that provides the target service (e.g. aws-s3 or aws_ec2).

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

container.label: blobstore
container.description: The name of the blob container.

directory.label: consumer,blobstore
directory.description: An optional directory name to use

group.label: producer,compute
group.description: The group that will be assigned to the newly created node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

hardwareId.label: producer,compute
hardwareId.description: The hardware that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

imageId.label: producer,compute
imageId.description: The imageId that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

locationId.label: producer,compute
locationId.description: The location that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

nodeId.label: producer,compute
nodeId.description: The id of the node that will run the script or destroyed.

nodeState.label: producer,compute
nodeState.description: To filter by node status to only select running nodes etc.

operation.label: producer,compute
operation.description: Specifies the type of operation that will be performed to the blobstore.

user.label: producer,compute
user.description: The user on the target node that will run the script.
